author: Aidan
title: PlayerMint P2: MetaVerse Toolkit
description: A MetaVerse is forming, yet it does not have an economic backbone that allows its users to own the digital assets they interact with.

assessments.note: Metaverse to reward gamers for playing, and this proposal addressed the integration challenge by allowing gamers to convert this rewards in NFT. Gamers are a compelling audience for Playermint. But this would benefit the community if the NFT were minted on Cardano.
assessments.reply: The CA may have not fully read through the proposal or misinterpreted a portion of it. They give quality praises regarding the proposals impact on the challenge, but then they state "But this would benefit the community if the NFT were minted on Cardano." All PlayerMint NFTs will be minted on top of Cardano.

assessments.note: Not clear on the economics of why PMX would be valuable. It seems to be highly inflationary with new tokens constantly generated.
assessments.reply:
The main reason any fungible token has value is due to the utility it provides to its holder and the work necessary in order to obtain it. In Bitcoin's case its utility is the ultimate form of a store of value and it requires Bitcoin mining in order to be obtained. In the case of PlayerMint's fungible token PMX the utility is access to the metaverse economic environment, the NFT system, PlayerMint DAO, and the use cases formed by the community. The work necessary in order to obtain it is the quality of gameplay performance in supported titles.

As for the economics of the token we have a deflationary model listed in the google doc attached to our proposal. This shows that the token supply being introduced each year till the supply cap is reached (155 million after 10 years) is deflating rapidly.

assessments.note: The problem statement chosen is rather generic but since they are having most of the things planned and documented accordingly the proposal effectively addresses the challenge
This proposal exceeds expectations with regards to addressing a challenge. It is clearly presented and well layed-out.
The team and vision of the project are its strong points. However, the development team Kromeon does not appear to be particularly suited to tackle the implementation - based on their self portrayal.
assessments.reply: Kromeon, our dev group, has reviewed the Cardano development documentation and came to the conclusion that they have the expertise needed to build out a quality product. They have experience working with the likes of the NFL, Dominos, Nordstrom, and Phillips 66.

assessments.note: The project plan is flushed out, and the team is leveraging what they are already doing in fund4. This is work in progress, as far as I understand.
The team seems to be experienced, however I would have liked some examples of previous work within blockchain development.
assessments.reply: Under the "Relevant Experience" category we list that we have team members with work experience in EMURGO. We also detail the specific years of work experience each team member has in the "additional details" section.

assessments.note: With senior developers and experienced people in bothe blockchain tech and gaimig platform the team looks self sufficient to achieve the proposed target.
The ground work has been laid-out in fund4 and it looks like they're progressing well by participating in fund5 as well.

While the proposal relies on the development work by an external entity, I belief that the team assessed the risk.

If implemented, this can boost adoption tremendously.

Outlined metrics and ongoing communication from the proposer to the greater community warrants a high score in auditability. An open source git repository would improve this score more.
The information provides is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
A very well structured proposal that contains all information I need to make an assessment.

To be successful this type of project needs to gain users. What is the marketing plan to bring on users and developers? Scarcity creates value. Why would either side be interested in a highly inflationary token. Where is the money coming from to pay the ADA fees to registers these tokens onto the blockchain?
assessments.reply: The Google doc linked in our proposal displays the token supply economics. The economics starts off with a larger supply and then has a strong deflationary model that caps after 10 years creating a max supply of 155 million.

assessments.note: They have provided both the context of their fund 4 and 5 proposal gives a continuity in their approach and the further documentation and details is sufficient to understand the proposal
There is a clear indication of the problem and solution and the YouTube videos add value.

solution: Creating an economic toolkit on Cardano so that MetaVerse users can earn, mint, and trade digital assets.
experience: Our team of 4 has a combined 45 years of experience in gaming and 10 years in blockchain. We've worked with EMURGO, E3, IGN, and IDG/GamePro
